intro: Justicia oldemanii, commonly known as the oldemanii flame flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, especially hummingbirds, due to their bright colors and nectar-rich structure. The plant is appreciated in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
